intro: Erodium oxyrhinchum subsp. oxyrhinchum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink to violet flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Geraniaceae family.
